description: Borrowed from Japanese アニメ (anime), an abbreviation of アニメーション (animēshon), itself borrowed from English animation, from Latin animatio, from animare.

nouns.description: anime (countable and uncountable, plural anime or animes)

entries.meaning: (uncountable) An artistic style originating in, and associated with, Japanese animation, and that has also been adopted by a comparatively low number of animated works from other countries.
examples: I can draw an anime version of you, if you want.

entries.meaning: (countable) An animated work that originated in Japan, regardless of the artistic style.
examples: After three months of successful sales in manga form, it was made into an anime for television.

entries.meaning: (rare, countable, chiefly proscribed) An animated work, regardless of the country of origin.

description: Borrowed from French animé (“animated”) (from the insects that are entrapped in it); or native name.

entries.meaning: Alternative spelling of animé, the resin of the courbaril.
